ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'any' (from Old English ǣniġ, meaning 'one, unique') and 'body' (from Old English bodiġ). The indefinite pronoun usage emerged through the combination of the two words.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any person; used primarily in questions, negative statements, or conditional clauses to refer to an unspecified person.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 任何人；主要用于疑问句、否定句或条件句中，指代未特定的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Did anybody call while I was out?
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我出去的时候有没有人打过电话？

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Every person; used in positive statements meaning 'no matter who' or 'everyone of a certain group'.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 任何人（都行）；用于肯定句中，表示“无论谁”或指代某个群体中的所有人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Anybody can learn to play the basics of this instrument.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 任何人都可以学会演奏这种乐器的基础知识。
